data.author: Chris Lalancette
data.message:
Switch to using the system version of octomap. (#244)

The new liboctomap-dev key pulls the octomap dependency from the system, rather than the ros-<distro>-octomap.
This will ensure a consistent ABI between octomap as used in system libraries and the one in ROS.

Signed-off-by: Chris Lalancette <clalancette@gmail.com>

data.message: Refactored intersection code.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Vectorized and simplified bodies::Box::intersectsRay().

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Utilize setDimensionsDirty() to increase performance.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Kinetic compatibility.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Added more containsPoint() tests.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Added more intersectsRay() tests.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Refactored intersection tests for better readability.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Moved all ray intersection tests to a dedicated test file.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Improved documentation.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Prevent reporting identical intersections multiple times in ConvexMesh::intersectsRay().

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Fixed computation of ConvexMesh::intersectsRay() for padded meshes and some other bugs.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
Stopped preventing GCC optimizations on Box::intersectsRay().

The reported problems no longer occur.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Fixed a case which could result in unwanted NaNs in Box::intersectsRay().

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
Fixed Cylinder::intersectsRay() to correctly return one intersection in case the ray is touching the cylinder side.

Also fixed the case when the ray goes exactly at the edge between base and sides.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Fixed Cylinder::samplePointInside() not transforming the generated point by the transform of the body.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Fixed ConvexMesh::containsPoint() to work correctly with padding.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Minor improvement in Box::intersectsRay().

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message: Simplified Box::containsPoint() and removed unnecessary helper variables.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
Fixed computation of Box::intersectsRay() in case the ray originates within the box.

A false second intersection was returned in that case, but as the ray starts inside the box, there should only be one intersection.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
Fixed computation of the ray-box intersections.

Even according to the link to the used method, the approach should only
work for axis-aligned boxes. But bodies::Box can be arbitrarily transformed.
So I instead strip rotation from both the box and the ray, which gives
the same results.

The old implementation would fail every time the untransformed min corner
ceased to be the min corner of the transformed box.

# Conflicts:
#	src/bodies.cpp

Added dirty versions of setScale/setPadding/setPose/setDimensions and made updateInternalData public.

This allows improving performance of ConvexMesh::setPose() by optimizing construction of the helper Box class.

data.author: Martin Pecka
data.message:
Throw runtime exception when a shape or body should have a negative dimension. (#106)

* Throw runtime exception when a shape or body should have a negative dimension.

Meshes are exceptions - you might want to give it a negative scale to mirror it. Although I'm not sure all member functions would tackle negative scale or large negative padding correctly.

* Making sure the objects are not changed in case wrong scaling/padding is requested.

data.message: changelog 0.5.2

data.author: Dave Coleman
data.message:
Issue #38: add aiProcess_RemoveComponent post-processing (#39) (#60)

* Issue #38: add aiProcess_RemoveComponent post-processing

This PR fix the particular problem I describe in the issue #38, but given the wide use of this package, someone more familiar with it should verify it doesn't brake any other usescases.

* Add new tests to verify that both load from file and generate from a pimitive produce equivalent meshes, and particularly that changes related to issue #38 don't break mesh loading.

* Add test to verify the number of vertex and triangles. Also test all shapes, instead of one randomly chosen

* Fix tangled code resulting from a faulty merge

data.author: Maarten de Vries
data.message: Switch boost::shared_ptr to std::shared_ptr.

data.author: Michael Görner
data.message:
relax mesh containment test (#58)

It does not need to know the exact number of vertices.
Also this breaks with new optimization steps during loading.

data.author: Lukas Bulwahn
data.message:
address gcc6 build error (#56)

With gcc6, compiling fails with `stdlib.h: No such file or directory`,
as including '-isystem /usr/include' breaks with gcc6, cf.,
https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=70129.

This commit addresses this issue for this package in the same way
it was addressed in various other ROS packages. A list of related
commits and pull requests is at:

  https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/issues/12783

Signed-off-by: Lukas Bulwahn <lukas.bulwahn@oss.bmw-carit.de>

data.author: Dave Coleman
data.message:
Merge pull request #43 from v4hn/indigo-lint

catkin_lint and cleanup

data.author: v4hn
data.message:
add notice that project will be built in Release mode

catkin_lint (rightfully) complains about this block that might
change CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE. Even so, without this block most people using
the git checkout (building locally) would wonder why MoveIt! is so slow
as they didn't specify Release build. So this will stay in here.
Nevertheless I suppose it's a good idea to leave a notice on the changed
build type in the logs.

data.author: v4hn
data.message: adhere to ROS' cmake style guide

data.author: v4hn
data.message: sort packages, components, and file lists

data.author: v4hn
data.message: add missing test_depend rosunit

data.author: v4hn
data.message:
don't use link_directories

Adding link directories is highly discouraged.
If the user installs his libraries some place unexpected,
he is responsible to add these places to the standard library path variables
instead of adding them on top of cmake.

data.author: v4hn
data.message:
remove deprecated assimp code

ubuntu 14.04 already provides assimp 3.0.x, so this is clearly deprecated.

Merge pull request #37 from corot/indigo-devel

Fix issue #28 on small radius cylinders

data.author: Jorge Santos Simón
data.message:
Merge pull request #1 from corot/issue28-patch-1

Fix issue #28 on small radius cylinders

data.author: Jorge Santos Simón
data.message:
Fix issue #28 on small radius cylinders

I came to this problem through an entirely different issue: Initialize a MoveIt! DepthImageOctomapUpdater takes ages for a turtlebot, because the poles are described as very small radius cylinders: top and h_num become 0 and the loop on line 514 iterates max unsigned int times.

This is the first time I see this code, so please, someone confortable with it, check that I'm not doing something silly!.

data.author: Steven Peters
data.message:
Add run_depend on visualization_msgs

I get a configuration error on utopic without this change:
~~~
CMake Error at /opt/ros/jade/share/catkin/cmake/catkin_package.cmake:217 (message):
  catkin_package() DEPENDS on the catkin package 'visualization_msgs' which
  must therefore be listed as a run dependency in the package.xml
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /opt/ros/jade/share/catkin/cmake/catkin_package.cmake:98 (_catkin_package)
  CMakeLists.txt:42 (catkin_package)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/ws/build_isolated/geometric_shapes/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "/home/ws/build_isolated/geometric_shapes/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
Makefile:675: recipe for target 'cmake_check_build_system' failed
make: *** [cmake_check_build_system] Error 1
<== Failed to process package 'geometric_shapes': 
~~~

data.author: Dave Coleman
data.message:
Merge pull request #26 from dornhege/indigo-devel

Prevent every mesh generation opening a new file handle.

data.author: Christian Dornhege
data.message:
Prevent every mesh generation opening a new file handle.

This causes a process to run out of file handles,
where the next fopen call returns nullptr, which is passed
into qhull, which segfaults.
Fixes ros-planning/moveit_ros#481 and
fixes ros-planning/moveit_ros#526.

data.author: Scott K Logan
data.message:
Better feature detection for assimp version

The unified headers were introduced in Assimp 2.0.1150, so checking for Assimp 3.0.0 is not quite the best solution.

See https://github.com/assimp/assimp/commit/6fa251c2f2e7a142bb861227dce0c26362927fbc

data.author: isucan
data.message:
Merge pull request #2 from v4hn/libqhull-support

support modern libqhull libraries

data.author: v4hn
data.message:
support modern libqhull libraries

The module was renamed from 'qhull' to 'libqhull'
and therefore geometric_shapes fails to compile on up2date systems.

This commit adds a proper cmake test module for various qhull
versions (taken from pcl) and passes the detected version on
via a config file. That way the resp. correct headers are included.
